title: Words with Prepositions
summary: Common combinations of adjectives and verbs with specific prepositions, with example sentences to aid learning.

sections.heading: Introduction
sections.content: Prepositions typically come before nouns or pronouns, helping to express aspects like time, location, direction, and more within a sentence. In English, some adjectives and verbs are commonly used with certain prepositions. Learning these combinations helps you express ideas more accurately.

sections.heading: Adjectives + Prepositions
sections.content: Some adjectives are usually followed by specific prepositions. Learning example sentences helps you remember these combinations better.

examples.example: I was surprised at the news.
We are excited about our holiday.
I was disappointed with our meal.

sections.heading: Verbs + Prepositions
sections.content: Many verbs are followed by specific prepositions. Example sentences help you understand and remember their correct usage.

examples.example: I arrived at the station at noon.
I asked the man for directions.
They didn’t invite us to the party.
We spent all the money on a trip.

sections.content: A quick-reference chart of common adjective and verb + preposition combinations with examples.
